subject: Re: [junit] time test passing, when the maximum time is '0'
msgSnippet: ... Test methods can t return a Test instance.  Again, I suggest you rearrange the code to look something like this: public class TestAllMethods { public
messageBody:
On Jan 10, 2005, at 7:19 PM, Harbir wrote:

> I have a bit of problem here, the following the code of the
> performance test (time test) that using the Junitpref.
>
> If you look I have setted the "maxTime" for maximum time a test should
> take to '0', and still the green bar is showing up, i mean still the
> test is passing where as it should not be.

> import com.clarkware.junitperf.TimedTest;
>
> import junit.framework.Test;
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
> import junit.framework.TestSuite;
>
>
> public class MyTest extends TestCase{
>
> public MyTest(String string) {
>
> super(string);
> }
>
> public static Test suite(){
> Test suite=new TestSuite();
> ((TestSuite) suite).addTest(new
> MyTest("testMyBrowserStatus"));
> return suite;
>
> }
>
> public Test testMyBrowserStatus(){
> long maxTime=0;
>
> Test test1=new Webtest1("testClaimsBrowseByStatus");
> System.out.println("testing");
> Test test11=new TimedTest(test1,maxTime);
> System.out.println("testing11");
> return test11;
> }

Test methods can't return a Test instance. Again, I suggest you
rearrange the code to look something like this:

public class TestAllMethods {

public static Test suite() {

long maxTimeExpected = 0;

TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();

Test test1 = new Webtest1("testClaimsBrowseByStatus");
Test timedTest1 = new TimedTest(test1, maxTimeExpected);
suite.addTest(timedTest1);

return suite;
}
}

public class Webtest1 extends TestCase {

public Webtest1(String name) {
super(name);
}

public void testClaimsBrowseByStatus() {
// functional testing goes here,
// but don't use JUnitPerf classes
}
}

Please also have a look at the following documentation for another
example:

http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html#howtouse

The 'samples' directory in your JUnitPerf installation also includes
working examples.

And if you have further questions, please post them to the JUnitPerf
mailing list:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junitperf/
